stimulusHtml: A light string is attached to a heavy stationary block on a rough surface. When a person pulls the other end of the string with a horizontal force of magnitude F0, the block remains at rest. Which of the following indicates where along the string, if anywhere, the tension has a magnitude of F02 and provides a correct justification?
choicesHtml: The tension is F02 in the middle of the string because the tension along the length of the string varies linearly from zero at the block to F0 at the person.
The tension is F02 in the middle of the string because the leftward and rightward tension forces both act on half of the string length at this location.
There is no location along the string where the tension is F02 because the tension has a magnitude of F0 at any location between the person and the block.
There is no location along the string where the tension is F02 because the block remains at rest.
